ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was able to become comfortable with understanding Italian and even producing some of my own, both verbally and in writing. I also gained appreciation for Italian culture and customs.
Knowledge of how to read, speak and translate Italian in all of the major tenses and build a base of vocabulary.
Learned a variety of tenses for basic conversation, reading, and writing of the Italian language.
In this class, I was able to practice my language skills in addition to developing my cultural awareness and sensitivity.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was taught well and was engaging. The writing assignments were fun and interesting. I would, however, have focused more on building conversational skills early in the course.
There could be fewer exams during the semester

Kathleen was an amazing professor and she did a very good job making sure we all felt comfortable with the material before moving on. That being said, there is a lot of content in this course so at the beginning, there does seem to be a test every week or so.
No complaints. The class was well designed as to help us succeed at every turn.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, as it is both interesting and useful.
Yes, especially if you can get Professor Kathleen Egan! She is great and a wonderful human being.

Yes, especially with Kathleen! She is engaging and funny and the class had a blast and learned more Italian than I expected out of a semester. It was engaging. One piece of feedback: more grade transparency. I didnt know how I was doing in participation, for example, until I asked.
Yes! You will learn a lot in just a semester, and if you are lucky enough to have professor Egan, she will do a great job making the material feel approachable.
I would recommend this course to any other student who wishes to learn Italian.
